oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The meaning of living environmental knowledge in productive activities: the case of a Finnish dairy farm
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mikkola, Minna
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Knowledge management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Individuals and communities need 'living' environmental knowledge as their particular resource in order to develop their environmental practices and identities. Environmental knowledge can be defined as embedded explanatory, instrumental and evaluative knowledge, offering the 'why' and 'how' for the actors.
